p: Notions of therapeutic misconception are difficult to overcome, even in conversation [ 27, 28]. Therefore, combining the established consent-process with supplementary tools (e.g. multimedia, [ 29â€“ 37]) is currently considered as a supportive measure. As the ability to successfully differentiate between research and treatment may, at its core, be related to conflicting cognitive frames, as suggested by Lidz et al. [ 30], they consequently advocate separating therapeutic from scientific research trials. Since this can be difficult to execute, increased general research education may also help alleviate therapeutic misconception.
